title: August 5. 1645. Whereas by speciall order of the House of Commons, the Committee for the Army under the command of Sir Thomas Fairfax did come to Guild-hall, London, to receive an accompt of the Lord Major and aldermen appointed as commissioners by ordinance of Parliament of the 15 of February, 1644. ...
author: England and Wales. Parliament. House of Commons.
notes: Title from heading and first lines of text.
An order of the Committee of the Army requiring ministers of churches and chapels to urge the payments of moneys assessed for purposes of war.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
